body_html:
Happily, there is solid documentation on building for iOS:
https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/tree/master/tensorflow/examples/ios#building-the-tensorflow-ios-libraries-from-source

tensorflow/contrib/makefile/build_all_ios.sh lets you set OPTIMIZE_FOR_GRAPH.
It will then generate tensorflow/core/framework/ops_to_register.h automatically.

This option was added in c4ef927, but the above docs still refer to tensorflow/contrib/makefile/tf_op_files.txt which seems to be outdated now (#20591).
body_text:
Happily, there is solid documentation on building for iOS:
https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/tree/master/tensorflow/examples/ios#building-the-tensorflow-ios-libraries-from-source
tensorflow/contrib/makefile/build_all_ios.sh lets you set OPTIMIZE_FOR_GRAPH.
It will then generate tensorflow/core/framework/ops_to_register.h automatically.
This option was added in c4ef927, but the above docs still refer to tensorflow/contrib/makefile/tf_op_files.txt which seems to be outdated now (#20591).
body:
Happily, there is solid documentation on building for iOS:
https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/tree/master/tensorflow/examples/ios#building-the-tensorflow-ios-libraries-from-source

`tensorflow/contrib/makefile/build_all_ios.sh` lets you set `OPTIMIZE_FOR_GRAPH`.
It will then generate `tensorflow/core/framework/ops_to_register.h` automatically.

This option was added in c4ef927b5eaf144dbf1e0419c0d1d3fd968177bd, but the above docs still refer to `tensorflow/contrib/makefile/tf_op_files.txt` which seems to be outdated now (#20591).
